title: Breakfast Roundtable with Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry | 10-12 Mid-Tier Companies & NIMP Strategic Co-Investment Fund (CoSIF) Recognised Market Operators
description:
This exclusive roundtable brings together 10-12 mid-tier companies and NIMP Strategic Co-Investment Fund (CoSIF) Recognised Market Operators for a high-level discussion with the Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry. The session will explore investment opportunities, trade facilitation, and strategic collaboration to drive Malaysia’s industrial transformation under the New Industrial Master Plan (NIMP 2030).

Key topics will include:
Enhancing market access and competitiveness for mid-tier companies
Opportunities for co-investment and funding through CoSIF
Strengthening public-private partnerships to support industrial growth
Strategies to position Malaysia as a key player in regional and global supply chains

This roundtable provides a unique platform for industry leaders to engage directly with policymakers, share perspectives, and explore collaborative initiatives that align with Malaysia’s long-term economic and industrial development goals.

title: Opening Remarks
description:
Dato’ Mohammad Faiz Azmi
Executive Chairman, Securities Commission Malaysia

title: Keynote Address 3: Harnessing ASEAN’s Trade and Industry Potential Through Sustainable Pathways – Insights from NIMP 2030
description:
Tengku Datuk Seri Utama Zafrul Tengku Abdul Aziz
Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry of Malaysia

title: Keynote Address 4: Strengthening ASEAN Connectivity for Sustainable and Inclusive Investment Opportunities
Presentation 3: Perspectives of ASEAN + 3: Trade & Investment Opportunities
description:
Tan Sri Andrew Sheng
Distinguished Fellow, Asia Global Institute, University of Hong Kong

title: Panel 4: ASEAN+3 Development Banks: Catalysing Sustainable Investment in ASEAN
description:
This panel brings together senior representatives from leading multilateral and policy banks to explore their role in driving sustainable investment and long-term economic resilience in ASEAN. Discussions will focus on key funding priorities, including green financing, digital infrastructure, and public-private partnerships that foster inclusive growth. Panelists will share insights on investment strategies, cross-border collaboration, and how these institutions are shaping ASEAN’s development landscape through strategic funding and innovative financial solutions.

Panelists:
Winfried F. Wicklein, Director General, Southeast Asia Department, Asian Development Bank
Sakuma Kazuko, Resident Executive Officer, Regional Head for Asia and Pacific, Japan Bank for International Cooperation
Shoufeng Liu, Deputy Chief Representative of Hong Kong Representative Office, The Export-Import Bank of China

Moderator:
Carol Fong, Group CEO, CGS International Securities Group

title: Panel 5: Driving Sectoral Growth – Real Stories of Impact and Inclusion Under the NIMP
description:
Strategic investments are the backbone of Malaysia’s economic transformation under the New Industrial Master Plan (NIMP), shaping high-impact growth across key sectors. In this panel, senior leaders from Khazanah Nasional, KWAP, PNB & EPF will share real-life case studies of how their investment strategies have fueled industrial development, created jobs, and empowered diverse communities.

This discussion will explore how capital deployment in critical industries, sustainable financing, and inclusive economic policies are accelerating sectoral transformation while ensuring long-term prosperity for all. With a strong focus on equitable growth, panelists will highlight initiatives that uplift local businesses, support workforce upskilling, and integrate ESG principles into Malaysia’s industrial roadmap.

This session will offer insights, challenges, and future opportunities in leveraging institutional investments to drive inclusive, resilient growth within ASEAN and beyond.

Panelists:
Dato’ Amirul Feisal Wan Zahir, Managing Director, Khazanah Nasional

Moderator:
Tan Sri Shahril Ridza Ridzuan, Independent Board of Director, CGS International Securities Malaysia Sdn. Bhd

title: Pitch for the Planet: Projects for Greener ASEAN [in collaboration with Bank Negara Malaysia]
description:
The ASEAN Pitch for the Planet (P4P) is a dynamic half-day event designed to showcase ground-breaking projects and solutions addressing climate change and environmental challenges across ASEAN. This platform connects innovative initiatives with potential investors, policymakers, and strategic partners to accelerate sustainable development and drive real impact.

Proposed Themes:
1. Energy Transition - Advance renewable energy, improve energy storage and grids, expand microgrids for better energy access, and promote electrification.
2. Climate Adaptation and Resilience - Climate-resilient infrastructure, water management, agriculture adaptation, and nature-based approaches to tackle climate risks.
3. Digital Solutions for Climate Action - Digital tools and technologies that improve climate risk management, disaster preparedness, and sustainable practices.
